Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: beata h
Reviews.Content: We're not surfers, just sailors. We've visited Puerto Rico from west to to east and from north to south. The Lazy Parrot offers one of the best quality hotels all over the island (we don't speak about the resorts). Better than Parador Villa Antonio which is absolutely awfull. And cheaper!!! The room we've been in, view on the swimming pool was perfectly designed, very clean and nice. Nothing negative to say on. The ambiance all around wonderfull. For an overnighter nothing better!!!

Reviews.Title: “Last night dinner”
Reviews.Author: tjclyde
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay here but had dinner at the rum shack the last night and it was great. The place is so beautiful and the staff was really friendly. We are planning to stay at the lazy parrot next year for sure. The food was also really yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy.........”
Reviews.Author: eldavid51
Reviews.Content: Nice place, nice pool, and nice rooms. Just warm water (in my room). Overall, good

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property but an Inn”
Reviews.Author: ChuckLu
Reviews.Content: This is a charming property but itâ€™s an Inn no posh hotel, the rooms are basic, the shower very basic (including hot water problems), Its located a few miles from the beaches, i.e. requiring a car (which you will need any way to get around) so overall OK location. The property itself, though small is nice and they have an OK restaurant (little over priced), staff seems to care and helpful. Breakfast is included which is an extra bonus. Beyond a cretin threshold, I am a big believer in the ratio between the cost and what you get. (AKA value). When you pay $300 a night you expect something totally different than when you pay $100 night. So this place is acceptable and rated â€œpassâ€� , for something like $100-120/night. Max.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Laura H
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Lazy Parrot. It was perfect for our family. We were able to check out board games 2 at a time (for free) which we played in the patio area in the evenings. The pool was perfect and my youngest (11) enjoyed it immensely. I agree with a previous reviewer that the room was a bit basic, but comfortable. One of the evenings we were there the hotel had live music. We were able to sit on our balcony and enjoy the music and beautiful weather. The staff was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “exactly what we hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: Socobobo
Reviews.Content: Upon our late arrival the room key was waiting for us just as promised! The room was perfect for us and our two boys. We had a balcony overlooking the pool with an absolute beautiful view. Worth paying the extra $$ not to stay in a value room. Not sure why some past reviews had issues with the hot water?!?!?! The four of us showered twice a day and the water was VERY hot and plentiful.The staff was always friendly,room was always perfectly kept,and the two ladies in the office always greeted us with a welcoming smile.The Lazy Parrot is in a perfect location with easy access to beaches,restaurants and the main route to other towns.No need to bring beach towels,chairs,or coolers because the LP provides them! Breakfast was enough to get your day started..fruit,yougurt,waffles,toast,bagels,muffins,pancakes,cereal,coffee,and juices. I would highly recommend a stay with the LP. It was hard to leave! Thanks for providing us with everything that your website advertised!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: nsp00
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at the Lazy Parrot Inn last week for a surfing trip with my son. I really enjoyed my stay and would happily return some day. Our room was a bit basic, but it was plenty comfy, had a nice balcony overlooking the pool, and was very clean. The staff were always super friendly and helpful, and the two dining options at the Inn were first rate. Indeed, my son and I tried several restaurants in the Rincon area during our stay and our meals at (the fancier) LPR and the (more casual) Rum Shack were by far the best. Overall, the Lazy Parrot manages to strike a really nice balance: efficient and well run, but with a laid back and friendly atmosphere that makes you feel instantly welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Leave, all in all a GREAT TIME”
Reviews.Author: LisaMendocinoCoast
Reviews.Content: Who wants to leave 80 degree weather, daily plunges in the pool, beach play and surf? Our stay at the Lazy Parrot was great. Room was comfy. They kept it clean for us daily. Super friendly staff. You need a car to venture outside of the hotel, but nicely situated outside of the central commerce area yet close enough to get amenities. Breakfast got old after a week; who eats the same thing every day? Fun things to do, miniature golf; yes, really. Someone really knew how to play golf, that was a kick. Internet could have been better; apparently one aspect was down. We wanted it in-room, but accessed it on the balcony. Good enough I guess. Also, hot tub was out of service though I seem to remember being told it was an attribute to the stay when we were booking; part of the two pools and a hot tubâ€¦. Ahh well, didn't really need the "hot." And we were told pool open until 10? Shut down at 6; I guess because the restaurant; still that was something we might have enjoyed a bit later than 6. Needless to say, the trip to Puerto and stay at Lazy Parrot was relaxing and a good time.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: Reed P
Reviews.Content: Perched on a hill between the two best beaches in Rincon, (Sandy and Tres Palmas), the Lazy Parrot gives you everything you need to make sure you're comfy, including two great dining options, clean beach towels, clean, comfy rooms, a pool, and great views over the hills all the way to the sunset on the water. And when i left my iPad, they sent it back to me within a day.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical getaway right in Rincon.”
Reviews.Author: D2theWest
Reviews.Content: What a fun loving, breezy, tropical hideaway I managed to find. The Lazy Parrot Inn is tucked away near the best surf in Rincon. My room was quiet, close to the pool, and had a nice tropical twist too it. It's like staying in a mini resort, great drinks, fun atmosphere, super staff. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Super-Clean, Super-Friendly, LOVE THIS PLACE!!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to the Lazy Parrot by a local after we arrived in town. After entering the Inn, I was surprised at how cool it was - It is a little tropical escape oasis! We spent most of our time lounging by the pool and the food at the Rum Shack was excellent. They make a delicious burger !! My room was large and up to date and super-clean. The bed was very comfortable and I found myself sleeping in later than I usually do. The staff at the front desk was super-friendly and went out of their way to answer my tourist questions. I stayed a week with my wife and it was the perfect little getaway for us. We give the Lazy Parrot 2 Thumbs Up. We will definitely be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Mystery Bugs.”
Reviews.Author: lostsurfer83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in Room 2. King size, cable tv, ac, internet and cell phone coverage were great. Bed wasn't too soft and neither were the pillows but i was too tired to care. Clean bathrooms and common areas. "Smiley" at the bar and the staff were very cool and courteous. Only mystery is that after i stayed there the second night i woke up covered in red bites. Mostly on my stomach and some on my right armpit. I consulted a dermatologist and she said that they looked to be bed bugs by their cluster like appearance and overnight occurrence. I asked the owner to check and she said there were none and that it could have been sea lice or sand bugs. I found that hard to believe because I know what sea lice feel like and what their bites look like and the bites occurred overnight in the evening before my flight when i didn't go to the beach at all that day. Its a mystery to me, but I would check your beds before crashing. I probably won't be coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Restaurant !”
Reviews.Author: Pam2960
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to dinner at the restaurant and the food was excellent. I must say it was the best food we had in PR. We had the Char Grilled Octopus salad and the Octopus was very tender and sweet. For the Entree I had a Pork Tenderloin over sweet potatoes I cant remember the name of the dish but it was the best I have ever eaten.The flavors were outstanding and cooked perfect. My husband had Snapper and this was also great.The chefs here do a great job!

Reviews.Title: “Will not go here again”
Reviews.Author: Holly P
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? 1) several flights of stairs... there is a good possibility that you will fall while you're here. There is a lot of tiling through out the place and between the afternoon showers and the watered plants, you're probably going to slip and fall. 2) Small rooms, which wouldn't have been so bad, but the bathrooms are terribly small and hard to move around...especially the shower! The shower curtain was an average sized curtain (which was folded in half to fit the small shower) and every single time I'd pull it back, sure enough a metal (and heavy) shower curtain ring would fall. The last time I got out of the shower, I got hit on the head (and the night before I had slipped on the stairs)... so I have come back with a few bruises. 3) HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE FOOD! I had read a lot of reviews (besides tripadvisor.com) and had read about which food items to avoid, so I did. Sure enough, I ordered a burrito ($14) and it was tasteless except for the burnt taste that came from the meat and tortilla chips... oh! And if you go here thinking that you'll just go ahead and try the burrito anyway, please be aware that litterally 3/4 of the burrito is stuffed with yellow rice. My husband got the pulled pork sandwhich and spit it out... (I tasted it and the "BBQ" sauce tasted like spaghetti sauce and the pork was dry) we had also ordered conch fritters.... I've never had a wet fritter, but this thing was over cooked and wet inside (all at the same time). I sent back the burrito and my bill was still $25... fyi NO FREE REFILLS so everytime you ask for a refill, that's $2 added to your bill and I KNOW I didn't drink a full can of coke. 4) Parking... goodness! Parking was horrible. Go there and you'll find out what I am talking about. Alone, I could tolerate the steep (and SMELLY ...the dumpster was never emptied while we were there and my husband and I would hold our breath while we ran to the car) parking lot but as I reflect on all the money I spent... it adds to my frustration! 5) hard pillows.... 6) After I cleaned up some hair in the bathroom, I had no other cleanliness issues 7) I was told "NO PETS", but heard a dog barking every morning and night ...SOOO ANNOYING! During the elections, vans with SUPER loud speakers drive around all day and night (we woke up to one) but obviously the motel cannot control this... My husband and I were eager every morning to get up and out of that place. Rincon is nice and we've been going there and will continue to visit, however I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Squawkin' good”
Reviews.Author: davidroths
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, very friendly, very reasonable and an excellent restaurant. Good location and easy drive to good beaches for snorkelling and surfing.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean hotel. Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: hobiecatsailor
Reviews.Content: I recently spent one night at the Lazy Parrott and was pleasantly surprised! I stayed in one of their newly renovated 3rd floor King rooms and it was very clean. The bed was very comfortable and there was a sliding door that opened up to a balcony overlooking the pool. The room had a table and chairs and the bathroom was clean with a walk in tiled shower. The public areas of the hotel were well appointed. The only draw back is that it was a long walk through the property carrying all of my luggage to get to the front desk. Once there, I had another long walk and had to carry my luggage up 3 flights of stairs. I would stay here again and it wasn't that big of a deal for me but I can see this being a problem for some travelers. Also, parking is in a lot on a hill across the street. Had it been raining when I was transporting my luggage back and forth that may have been a problem but I got lucky, the weather was nice. This is a small hotel with a friendly, quaint feel to it and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not all that”
Reviews.Author: galtjohngalt
Reviews.Content: For all the hype, this place is not all that. My wife and I are birders, so we look for a base of operations rather than a hang-out. There are 3 things I look for; a comfortable bed (their's was not bad; not the best but certainly not the worst I've slept on), a clean room (and it was), and a hot shower. It took a good while for the water to warm up. Some days it never quite warmed up enough, and it was a trickel rather than shower, but I've seen worse. The people are freindly enough. Room #1 was pretty small and had some minor issues (drawers that didn't open, for example). We got a mini-fridge, a microwave and the essentials. When the crowd's leaving at night, the noise echoes off the walls here and makes sleeping before 10 challenging at times. We had an issue with water that turned out to be much more major than expected and was certainly no fault of the hotel. We were relocated to a much nicer room (#305). As others have pointed out, you want a room above the pool; the difference is night and day. We'd have been thrilled to have had this room from the beginning of our stay and in fact asked from the outset for a room over the pool but this request was not honored until the pipe leak/water issue. Great water pressure here, nicer layout, more spacious; nicer all around. I want to warn you- the tiled steps around the place are very slippery when wet!! Be careful. I could've been really hurt sliding off the steps at one point but thankfully received only minor scrapes. The staff noticed and were genuinely concerned about this but I insisted I was OK. We tried both restaurants. The upstairs/higher-end Lazy Parrot version, although pricier, is worth the difference in price. Try it at least once. There is an octopus appetizer that will knock your socks off. We were blown away by how good the food was here. The Rum Shack was also OK and more reasonably priced. My wife and I are not your average tourists and are in fact quite intrepid. We explored much of the western end of the island by car from this one base; Maricao, Guanica, Cabo Rojo (highly recommended), Arecibo and Guajataca. We spent a day in Old San Juan as well. Driving here is dangerous. If you've ever driven in Central America, you'll have a primer in what it might be like, but it is barely comparable. The DR is similar in respects with one critical difference. The roads in Puerto Rico are small by any standards, often smaller than the width of two cars. Guajataca for example is simply hazardous to attempt and certainly not for the faint of heart. Route 2 is not bad and is flat but is crowded and riddled with traffic from dawn to dusk and beyond. The secondary roads are just wide enough to get by and the locals are used to them. They will fly by you at breakneck speed and scare the h377 out of you. Great fun if you're ready for it. The interior of the island is full of mountains and makes for windy twisty roads as well, adding to their complexity. Don't try the dirt roads without 4 wheel drive and consider Guajataca only if you have a lot of extra time. We also discovered that some roads simply end, in spite of their existence on our map (from Amazon). We've seen this in other places as well but here it caught us off guard at least once.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck with a Leaky Ceiling”
Reviews.Author: missjr
Reviews.Content: Our ceiling was leaking (and our room kinda smelled). We called the after hours number to try and switch our room but were told there was nothing that could be done. I'm not sure I would stay here again - but the amenities of the hotel were nice. Nice pool, good breakfast, pretty scenery, a short drive to the beach and local bars.

Reviews.Title: “Relax tropical mood”
Reviews.Author: Enrique68
Reviews.Content: Went there for drinks. Nice staff, incredible setting , overall a very nice experience. Will go back to try dinner( people say its very good)

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay on West Coast, and has GREAT food!”
Reviews.Author: authored
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in other locations both in Rincon and other cities on the West Coast of PR, but this is the best for value and service. Make certain that you take one of the larger (and much nicer) rooms near the pool so you do not have road noise. The food at the "Rum Shack" near the pool is superb and reasonably priced. The road (rt 413) it is on is dicey, if you are not accustomed to Puerto Rican highways. Bottom line: a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best place for a vacation !!!”
Reviews.Author: dannyuchiha
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience when I stayed in December. When we confirmed the reservation, they offered to upgrade our room for free! This is the best place I've gone for a vacation and we're definitely coming back. Everything about it is perfect, the relaxing atmosphere, the rooms, the staff, it feels as though you've entered an enchanted place that's meant for you to relax :)

Reviews.Title: “Great lil Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: NanaBoop
Reviews.Content: This lil Inn was so enchanting and romantic. I great lil place to relax, sit by the pool and veg. If you are an active person it is near the beach and centrally located to all you would want to do in Rincon. our bed was so comfortable and had our own private balcony. There are only two things I can say negative about the place. The water pressure was low when taking a shower, but I loved the place so much I didn't care. The $$$ restaurant the bears same name, but is separate from hotel was awful. My husband's pasta tasted like soap and my pork tenderloin was raw in the middle. We both had to send our meal back and we don't complain. Either eat out or stick with the food at the Rum Shack by the pool. Reasonably priced and very plentiful. I had the best burger of my life there. Staff is very friendly and room price includes a nice continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent The only bad thing about this place is leaving!”
Reviews.Author: Jose P
Reviews.Content: As a local PR surfer (back in my day), now residing in the mainland the atmosphere of "The Lazy Parrot" really summarizes my type of place nothing to do but enjoy drinks and sunshine even in December. If ever planning on visiting the island, a few days in The Lazy Parrot should be a must to enjoy our beach culture. Nothing I can write can compare to the experience. If you like great service and tropical settings this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden jewel...”
Reviews.Author: silvison
Reviews.Content: First off, I like to stay in fancy hotels. My boyfriend however is more about the "experience" meaning he could stay in a shack on the beach. Since he was paying I reluctantly agreed to the Lazy Parrot. From the street it looks pretty basic but step inside...It's like a jungle oasis. My somewhat buget oriented boyfriend picked the value room #1. It was pretty basic, just like you see in the pictures. However it was cozy and clean, and I ended up really liking it.It was super cheap and definitely worth the price. When I go back though I will definitely book a superior room overlooking the pool which has great views of the jungle and ocean and nice balcony. This place relaxes you to the bone. You will meet great people and local expats. The staff was so wonderful. Also they have two fun bars and a restaurant. In my opinion the best food we had in Rincon was at the restaurant which also was served food at the bar. This place is just so special and will sooth your weary soul. However as I read the bad reviews I think it's fair to say if you expect a Ritz Carlton or even a Hyatt, this place might seem too rustic for you. However as someone who lives for staying at nicer hotels, I was enormously surprised. By the end of my stay I had fallen in love. I learned that sometimes the most expensive hotel is not the nicest. I LOVE THIS PLACE!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
Reviews.Title: “Great price; room had issues....”
Reviews.Author: Mazzahs
Reviews.Content: I visited the Lazy Parrot 2 years ago on my first trip to Rincon. I visited w/ my cousin & friend and the restaurant & 2 bars (rum bar included) were stellar. The grounds are breathtaking behind the seemingly dull front exterior. The hotel is NOT on the beach, but the views overlooking the valley between the beach and the hotel are awesome. In addition, the grounds beyond the restaurant are like walking through a rainforest. The pool, bars, steps, hotel, etc. are reminiscent of venturing through El Yunque. My girlfriend & I arrived after 5 after visiting my favorite beach (Maria's) to check out the local scene & surfing. We drove up from Ponce and had no reservations which was our MO for the entire trip. Much to our surprise, the desk was closed with a message to call a number for questions or last minute bookings. We called the # and a gentleman was expeditious in driving over to check us in. He brought us into the laundry area, opening a book that read, "walk-ins". The options for rooms were all under $100 including tax which were the cheapest of our trip; I didn't object. The 3rd floor room was great initially as it had been recently renovated. Awesome floors, tile bathroom throughout, great bedding/bedroom furniture. However, our big issue was the the upfront mildew malodor upon entry. I've detected this odor before but it's usually caused by older carpet & linens which were absent here. So, we investigated the wall a/c unit (which was the only remaining culprit) and detected massive black mold within the unit. My girlfriend mentioned objecting, but for the rate and our late arrival, I suggested a quick trip to Econo to purchase some lysol to rectify the situation. This did the trick since we were only staying 1 night. We left the a/c unit off and opened up all available openings. Keep in mind, this unit is on the eastern end/3rd floor which is obstructed by palm trees and thus, minimal sunlight. We loved the Lazy Parrot; the only reason for a less than stellar review is the malodor from the neglected a/c unit. I was wheezing after a bit and the only reason I could imagine was the mold w/in the a/c unit. We mentoned the issue to management upon departure and we were met w/ concern wholeheartedly. This in no way detracts from the beauty of the hotel/grounds, but the a/c neglect on the eastern end may hinder your otherwise phenomenal stay in this gem....

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay -”
Reviews.Author: OBeeJay
Reviews.Content: This is a decent location within Rincon. The location avails its self to a nice view from your room and convenient access to surfing and snorkeling. The room is just fine. Its clean etc. Unfortunately during my stay, The internet did not work at all during all the days of my stay. the hot water was tepid at best and freezing cold on the last day. Very disappointed about the lack of a decent shower facility with hot water. I don't ask for much, but in the price category i do fully expect to have hot water. Staff is nice and friendly. Pool / Bar / Restaurant - its available if you desire. I found it to be very over priced. There are many dining options in the area - seek out food at an alternative location if you are traveling on a budget. The bar is a very nice location to meet others and relax, Pretty decent view of the sun set also. :) In the future I would most likely seek alternative lodging. But try your luck, they might have hot water!

Reviews.Title: “Well-done Comfort”
Reviews.Author: ShiningHalo
Reviews.Content: Things I Liked about the Lazy Parrot: -The price was right -Tastefully decorated from top to bottom -Even though it's a "mini-resort," it doesn't feel pretentious or uppity; just comfortable--like coming home. -Food at the Rum Shack was great -Friendly, very helpful staff -The view from our room was GREAT, and we got a HUGE balcony (patio would be more accurate) without requesting it/paying more Things I Didn't Like So Much: -For being a hotel in a city all about surfing and beaches, there were painfully few places in the room/bathroom to hang up wet items. Our "closet" wasn't even tall enough to hang up a shirt without the bottom brushing the shelf! (We had the railings outside on our balcony, of course, but since it rained both our nights there, that was counter-productive) -The shower and I didn't get along. Futzy temperature control burned me, then froze me. Water pressure left something to be desired. Overall, the good definitely outweighs the bad, and I would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Year after year, my #1 choice in Rincon & the west of PR”
Reviews.Author: Puertoricosigns
Reviews.Content: Stayed there again a couple weeks ago. The place is awesome, year after year. Clean rooms, a great place to relax, very friendly staff. This time we ditched the kids & went with another couple- surf trip. I wrote another review about the place a few years ago, and I'd write the same thing all over again. I love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great times helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ken A
Reviews.Content: It's a secluded spot, quiet reasonably priced and they even upgraded my room. I'll be back! I loved the Rum Shack. Jim and Mitch are quite the hosts. Rooms are clean, beds are comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal - fun for couples and families”
Reviews.Author: Amy W
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only spent one night in this gem. Fun atmosphere, clean, stylish rooms, good food, local brew and lively conversation in the Rum Shack! We were in town for less than 24 hours and a surf lesson (which was awesome). The Lazy Parrot was perfect for us (on an anniverary vacation) - we wished immediately we could stay longer! We also noted how perfect it would have been to bring our kids... pool, hot tub, miniature golf - vertical style. Long story short ... you can t go wrong - the price is awesome and the laid back style is perfect. We were in the newer portion of the Inn, Ocean/pool view... can't speak to the rest of the rooms. Quaint surf town! Ramse was our surfing instructor and was really great. Highly recommend him as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lazy Parrot is the jackpot for value and quality of experience”
Reviews.Author: LC64804
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into the Parrot for a quick, three-night anniversary trip. We came down to surf and snorkel. I'd found the Parrot online, and didn't know anything about it, other than reviews I'd read- I was a bit nervous because of the great deal I found on Expedia, but was more than pleasantly surprised upon our arrival. Parking is across the street (big lot, tons of room), and we stayed in room #1- king bed with a standard small patio. The room was super cute- not decorated in the cheesy, overdone, "tropical" look- it felt like a room at a friend's beach house. The room was prety large, with the bed, two nightstands, a built-in vanity, a small refrigerator, a small closet with a microwave, a very pretty updated bathroom, and a small, enclosed patio with two chairs and a small table. LOVED the room!!! Romantic, and had all of the featured you'd need on a trip. It was also very, very clean. AC was nice and cold. The grounds are beautiful, and we spent a considerable aount of time at the Rum Shack- lots of locals come by to eat, so it's a great place to meet some friendly and interesting people. The food was delicious (I recommend the conch fritters and mahi tacos!), but the LP restaurant was closed for the slow season, so we didn't get to eat there. Plenty fo tasty options nearby and close to town. Complimentary breakfast at the Parrot was ideal- just walk downstairs for coffee, waffles, bagels, fruit, yogurt, etc. Francia with the LP was very helpful to me in plannign my trip- she was able to give me info on surf lessons, directions, ater-hours check-in, dining, etc. I highly recommend the Parrot to anyone traveling to Rincon!! You won't be disappointed, and you'll get a TON of bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: statenisland522
Reviews.Content: if you can get a room in the back. i was in the front.the staff was very nice and got great directions from san juan they do need a little better job at cleaning the rooms before guests get there but was taken care of right away

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Tropical Inn in the Hills of Rincon”
Reviews.Author: SunFL0WER_10
Reviews.Content: I must admit that when my husband and I first arrived, I was initially alittle disappointed from the looks of the Lazy Parrot from the front entrance and very skeptical about what our stay would be like. Once we entered, I was quickly reminded that looks can be deceiving and not to judge a book by its cover. Inside, we found a beautiful, clean, and tropical atomosphere that was very charming and quite relaxing. The staff was friendly and very accomodating, including the hotel manager in the office, the bartenders, and the housekeeping staff. Very unexpectedly, we needed to add two more nights to the end of our trip when our flight home was cancelled due to a tropical storm. We were offerred an excellent rate and were allowed to stay in the same room without a problem, even though it was already booked for other guests (who were moved to another room). The food at the Rum Shack in the Lazy Parrot was probably the best we had during our stay in Rincon, even compared to the other highly recommended restaurants we went to. The gardens were beautiful and it was very nice to stroll around the hotel at night and sit outside, especially since everything is lit up so beautifully when it gets dark. Just make sure you bring or buy ALOT of bug spray because I was eaten alive by mosquitos, but that goes with the territory when you visit the tropics. It was off season when we were there so there were no activities or any entertainment at all at the hotel and the main restaurant and bar were closed. In the hotel's defense, the website did state that the restaurant and bar would be closed and didn't list any activities for the off season, but it would be nice if there was something going on, at least on the weekend, to cater to guests who visit during this season. During our extra two days, it rained all day because of the storm and there was absolutely nothing at all to do. When we visit Rincon again, we will probably go during high season because there wasn't anything to do other than the beach, but we would definitely stay at the Lazy Parrot again!! Just consider the time of year when booking your trip if you're looking for activities other than the beach. Another thing to mention is that there are quite a few steps at this 3 level hotel, which wouldn't be a problem at all except that they are very, very, very, extremely slippery when they are wet.... And since people are always wet from the pool and the beach, the steps were always very slippery. I fell twice, once on the way up the steps in the front of the hotel and once on our way down to the Rum Shack from our room... and I still have the bruises to prove it. By the end of our trip, I was paranoid about walking up and down the steps without falling. But please don't let any of my comments stop you from staying at the Lazy Parrot Inn because it really is the loveliest hotel in Rincon. Just make sure your flip flops have good grips on the soles to avoid falling like I did. Overall, we had a wonderful time on our trip and I highly recommend the Lazy Parrot Inn. My husband and I look forward to staying again during out next trip to Rincon.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise while travelling around the island.”
Reviews.Author: gdtwo
Reviews.Content: Getting there was half the fun, we got lost (of course) and ended up asking a taxi driver for directions. Marvelous people, very friendly in Rincon. Once at the Lazy Parrot, we were greeted by an exceptionally friendly staff and spent the evening out by the pool drinking rum punch, really good rum punch. They served dinner by the pool and more rum punch. Reno took great care of us there. Our room was spacious, clean, large and eclectic. We could see the Carebbean in two different directions from our vantage point. Breakfast was simple fare, fresh fruits, cereals and the like, but very good. Only had time to spend the one night but will be back to spend many more lazy days! And we got to experience a 5.8 earthquake, bonus!!!

Reviews.Title: “No more no less than expected.”
Reviews.Author: oscarcor1
Reviews.Content: Lazy Parrot is a small inn in the quiet hills of RincÃ³n, Puerto Rico. As a local couple from San Juan, we were looking for a quiet place to relax, with the right price, good service, a good restaurant with the right prices and a comfortable and clean room. We got it all. If you are looking for a fancy place with a spectacular look, Lazy Parrot is not the place. Actually the outward look of the place is ordinary. We will certainly return and already recommended to others looking for what we were looking for,

Reviews.Title: “Great gathering place for family and friends”
Reviews.Author: etaurins
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect place to be when you want to visit Rincon and also want to spent time with friends and family in a "non-hotel-lobby" atmosphere. I went to a destination wedding in the area and after the arranged gatherings and some private beach time we all met up at the casual breakfast area, the cozy pool, and the outdoor dining/bar. The food was reasonably priced, fresh, and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, very laid back and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Kaliahpr
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Lazy Parrot as part of a wedding party in Rincon. We arrived at 4 a.m., and the directions and room key location were accurate enough to get us there in the pitch dark from Aguadilla airport. While the room was clean, it was sparse (no telephone or clock; and an unbelievably stinky refrigerator). And with no weatherstripping on the door, biting flies who visited from the outdoor hallway left me many souvenirs from tropical PR. On the upside, the staff, especially the bartenders, were very helpful with where to go and what to do. The food was very good, and the view was amazing. Rincon itself is a series of windy, narrow, poorly marked and unlit roads, so getting around is a challenge. I probably won't stay at the Parrot again. Despite its charm and laid back appeal, there was simply no relief from getting eaten alive by flying visitors, even in the bathroom and while sleeping!

Reviews.Title: “Polly Wanna Stay at the Lazy Parrot!”
Reviews.Author: Katlanta
Reviews.Content: What a cute place! Our room was very nice, had a great view of the valley and the Atlantic in the distance. The staff were very nice, and housekeeping did a great job of keeping our room spotless all the time. We had a mini-fridge and good AC. Jahby and the other staff were wonderful, the gift shop was cute, and we loved all the murals and mosaics around the property. The flowers were beautiful. Plenty of parking. We went to sleep hearing the coqui frogs singing over the air conditioner in our room. It was the off season, so only the Rum Shack was open -- none of the other restaurants. In fact, many things in Rincon are closed Memorial Day - Thanksgiving. But the pool area was no less cheery, friendly, or well maintained. The one comment I have - and this is not a complaint - is that they have this beautiful jacuzzi-like tub that looks like the most inviting hot tub you've ever seen. However, it's colder than the pool. It was never intended to be hot. It rained most of the time we were there, so we spent a good bit of time in the pool, in the rain, and kept wishing the Not Tub were a Hot Tub. Also, since it was overcast, the water in the shower was probably in the low 80s max. Totally fine, but guessing they have a solar hot water heater. No biggie, though -- it's actually pretty standard in the Caribbean. The location was convenient to all the beaches in town. We didn't want to leave, and I hope we can return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to unwind...”
Reviews.Author: GemstoneIslaVerde_PR
Reviews.Content: Very friendly owner and staff, the facility is tastefully done, quality furnishings are used and attention to detail during construction was obvious, fit and finish is very professional. Our room was excellent, all tile floors, tile bath and shower, air conditioner worked flawlessly, ceiling fan moved the air well, bedding was very comfortable, good quality. Small refrigerator and microwave. Continental breakfast was adequate, fresh fruit, bagels, cereals, pastries, juice, milk and great coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Looooooove the LP”
Reviews.Author: emily_twist
Reviews.Content: The Lazy Parrot was the perfect choice for my trip. My friend and I planned it at the last minute- three weeks before. We just wanted to get away, lay on a beach, and not really think about anything. But we're not exactly rich. This was the perfect balance- an adorable little "resort" with everything we needed: clean room, two bars, two restaurants, and free breakfast. It was close to all the beaches (driving- I wouldn't go to Rincon without a rental car) and had a great, laid back vibe. Everyone who works there is super friendly, and actually everyone who was staying there was pretty friendly too. I could go back next weekend. By the way, both restaurant/bars are great. We ate there every night, partially because we were too lazy to go anywhere else, partially because they were so good. The Rum Shack is more laid back- poolside burritos, burgers, pulled pork sandwiches, etc. Jim is the best! (All of the bartenders are the best, actually.) The upstairs restaurant (I think it's called the Lazy Parrot Restaurant?) is a little more fancy (which is to say, the food is more refined, but you definitely don't need to get dressed up to go there) and expensive, but soooo worth it. In our many meals there, we had the ceviche, steak, fish, mussels, conch chowder, coconut bread pudding... Oh, the coconut bread pudding. I'm seriously salivating thinking about it right now. The kitchen is amazing, and Amy (the owner) is super nice. And pretty. Go here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great guest house find!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: April711
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at The Lazy Parrot (cute name!) in Rincon, Puerto Rico. Actually, we were fortunate to win a free stay that was donated by the owners to the Animal Rescue Foundation of Rincon (which we think is very nice that they support their community!). We had a lovely, clean room with a balcony overlooking their fabulous pool and lush garden. They offer a continental breakfast, and what a breakfast it is -- fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt, bagels, muffins, and more. The entire staff, from Jabby in the office, to the cleaning ladies, maintenance guys, bartenders and waitstaff are very nice and helpful. They have a funky little bar down by the pool where we enjoyed lunch, and a very good restaurant upstairs (delicious fish and a coconut bread pudding -- we're still salivating). Also, nice background music -- not too loud or late. What a great find this guest house is and we plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Central location. Great for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: Fun_In_the_Sun62
Reviews.Content: We stayed Dec 28, 2010 to Jan 4, 2011. Yes it is deceiving from the street. Hey it is the Caribbean! We were on the 3rd floor poolside. Nice room, great having the fridge. It was very clean. nice comfy bed. Staff was helpful. It forced us to get in the car and explore. The little bakery next door makes awesome sandwiches cheap. The banana smoothie place on the other side of the Parrot is really good too. A rainy Sunday we got a pitcher of the banana orange smoothie and added some local rum....great football day for us! the parrot had beach chairs, beach towels and cooler to sign out for the week. Grocery and liquor store were close by. Breakfast was fine. The English Rose is the BEST for breakfast. The LP restaurant was great food. Make the trek down to Cabo Rojo and bring food and beverage, spend the day. Incredible place. Gorgeous beach. For the $$ the Lazy Parrot was great. will definitely visit again!

Reviews.Title: “DREAM VACATION SPOT-WELL ALMOST”
Reviews.Author: G-Genoski
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Tuesday evening to the Inn.At first impression,we thought we actually got scammed.From the street,you do not see the Inn in all its glory.You just see a housefront with bed with a parrot in it in a glass display.We finally mustered the courage to enter an we were incredibly surprised with the Tropical charm this place has. After 5pm,there is nobody there to greet you or direct you to your room.Word to the wise...DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME ASKING THE RESTAURANT-BAR EMPLOYEES ANYTHING ABOUT THE HOTEL.All you get is" We are not part of the Hotel-sorry.Heres an emergency number if you have any issues" We had Dinner at the Rum Shack which is next to the pool.Cute,good tasting food,but quite overpriced compared to other restaurants a few miles away in town. But back to the Inn- We found our key as per instructions and found our room.Very nice and clean room with amazing views.Didnt expect a fridge and microwave to be part of the deal,a nice extra touch. The next morning we met the manager,the sweetest and most helpful person you could ever meet. Everything was amazing till Friday evening.Being that this place has 2 dinning areas and 3 alcohol consuming areas the place packs up with non hotel staying visitors.Something we were unaware of till we got to the hotel Friday evening.There is NO CONTROL OVER PARKING FOR HOTEL GUESTS.I questioned this situation with the restaurant atttendee and as stated before their answer was"We are sorry,we are Not part of the Hotel"......I brought this to the attenton of the shift manager in the morning,got a million appologies,but Saturday night was even worse,cause now they had a Live band and every Local surfer was there to party.This happens almost every weekend as I was told by some local resident and Bussines owners I spoke to. We had use of the pool during these hours,but,It felt very odd to be in the pool with all these party people staring you down including the waitreses,like if we were doing something wrong.(Forgot to mention,they open a huge screen in front of the pool at night with surf movies,so it is impossible to not be seen when you enter the pool) Is this a nice place to stay if you are without children.YES.Its a party hot spot. Is it a nice place to stay with young children? Not really. Im not putting the place down or promoting it.Just giving an honest and detailed review of our stay.To us,.the Hotel and Personel get a 5 star rating,But the Restaurants,bar,parking issues and a few of their employees (2 upstairs) just took away the desire to return to this little paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Unsafe, Office closed, gave no directions. Told to leave car unlocked!”
Reviews.Author: kcaulfield
Reviews.Content: On 12-10-10 around noon my husband and I called for a room at the Lazy Parrot in Rincon PR following a week cruise. We were told they had rooms and they asked for a Credit card number to hold a room. It took us several hours to get to the area where the Inn was located. Our Navigator did not recognize the address. It was described as being next to a lighthouse so we drove around until we found the lighthouse but the Lazy parrot was not visibly close. Hours of driving around this small surfing town. We asked several people where the inn was and we were given several directions. All the time making phone calls to the inn asking for help. Always getting voice mail. When we found it. There was no one at the inn. However we discovered a close office with our names on an envelope with a room number and key inside. We had no idea where to park as there was no parking lot, or a place in the street for any cars to park, so we went to the room to see if there were instructions. The instructs directed us to park on the beach. The only beach we saw with hours of driving was quite a long ways downhill and would be more than a half hour to walk back (uphill) It also directed us to not leave any personal items in the car and leave the door unlocked. Being an expensive SUV rental car this worried us. Furthermore, we had many expensive items in the car, much too many and heavy to carry the many stairs, up, then down, then up just to get to our roof top room. There was no one there at the Hotel to consult about the parking or to help us carry all the items we were to keep safe. On top of all that Charged our Credit Card $141.00! Tried to email and call Email bounces back and only get voice mail!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: EarlFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7 years ago and at that time, it was a charming, boutique, funky, fun, small gem of an inn. Now it is a mini-resort, more than double the original size, with busy and impersonal staff and priced well beyond its value. We would give this one a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, relaxing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: relax_enjoy27
Reviews.Content: I think some of the more recent reviews were unnecessarily harsh of this cute hotel, so i felt obligated to defend it. We also enjoyed our weekend there VERY much. The directions to the facility were spot on...the parking lot is a little tricky (it's on a steep hill) but nothing that will remotely dampen your vacation. The staff was VERY welcoming & helpful. The food & service at the Run Shack was very good. Our room was clean & welcoming & we all had a wonderful nights sleep in our comfortable beds. The continental breakfast was a great way to start the day, no complaints there either!! The atmosphere is VERY relaxing....just what we wanted & needed. The only thing i would recommend is that customers be made "aware" if they are slotted to stay in any of the "front" rooms near the lobby/restaurant, as they can be a bit noisy with all the foot traffic, so they know what to expect & plan accordingly. That is the only thing i have that resembles a complaint....all in all....very very happy customers!!!!!! Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found? You Bet!!”
Reviews.Author: surfer02_10
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to Rincon and The Lazy Parrot-----my son and I love this little piece of heaven! We are both surfers and the main draw to Rincon is for the world class surfing, but when we leave the beach, the Parrot is the icing on the cake! Last January we stayed in the original section of the hotel and that was very nice, and this year we elected to try the poolside ( a new section ), and that was even better! The rooms in the newer section are bigger and we had a terrific view of the hills and valleys nearby. The best part was the unique Coqui frogs that would chirp in the evening---better than counting sheep to put you to sleep! Every morning we caught a perfect sunrise from our porch---what a way to start the day! The hotel breakfast was plenty enough to get us on our way to the beach for several hours of surfing. Bagels, yogurt, cereal, fruit, coffee, tea or milk---just right! The staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful as well. One morning my son damaged his board on the reef. We had a repair kit handy, but it wasn't enough to complete the repair. The hotel maintenance man, Sam, went out of his way to get us the additional items we needed, and later that day my son was back on his board enjoying the waves. Thanks again Sam! What's not to love about this place. We are already planning our trip for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not for those wth knee problems”
Reviews.Author: MrBill57
Reviews.Content: This is a good review for this inn. Clean, average to above average accommodations, friendly/ helpful staff. Cons: no elevator for this 3 level inn ( lots of stairs in you are booked on third floor) parking is across the street( DON'T park in bakery lot next door). We had a pleasant stay .

Reviews.Title: “Lazy Parrot is amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: meg081
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect when we arrived in RIncon in the middle of the night and were pleasantly surprised when we checked in at the Lazy Parrot. The atmosphere is unlike any hotel I've ever been. It's a comfortable and quaint; clean and airy. It's a beautiful place that we would go back to in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT, LOVED IT,LOVED IT.....”
Reviews.Author: BRITEX55
Reviews.Content: Hard to find but when you have was totatally worth it.. We had King room over pool,beautifully clean.. Great food, courteous staff can't wait to get back there....

Reviews.Title: “Ironic”
Reviews.Author: sanjas1001
Reviews.Content: It was literally ironic I came to this Resort because all of the good reviews it had. But I was surprised when I found out that it was terrible. The room was not what I expected, too little, the bed was uncomfortable, the air conditioner was so noisy I couldn't sleep the last night and for the last the pool was dirty. I almost forgot prepare to take a shower with cold water. There's no service, the buffet breakfast is very poor. I will never return to this place again, maybe if is for free!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, clean.. but lacks service!!”
Reviews.Author: FranCarrollton
Reviews.Content: If you want some kind of service, arrive between 9 and 5. After that, good luck.. This hotel is not very easy to find.. even with directions. and I'm from Puerto Rico!! We had to ask several people, and the last person drove to the place and we followed. We also arrived at 7p and the office was closed. That's fine, but there was no one else to help or take you to your room, which was again not easy to find. The only employees were at the restaurant and the bar. When you ask the staff, there was no animosity, either. There are many stairs and you have to haul your own luggage, in the dark of the night. Only young people can manage this, or arrive when there's someone to help! The breakfast is a basic continental breakfast, just to get you going. The restaurant is overpriced. On a good note, the room was clean and the beds are comfortable. Small, rough towels, though. And the beach is just 5 minutes away by car. Being a travel agent for more than 20 years, I can assure you that Service is very important for a traveler. Most people who come to this hotel have to drive from San Juan and it can take 2-3 hours depending on the traffic, rush hour, etc. This hotel didn't offer the service expected. Totally disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding..can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: beachy23465
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a beautiful, very clean comfortable room with a balcony overlooking the pool and bar area. Over the hills you could see the ocean. We loved it! The bar/restaurant served excellent food and drinks at very reasonable prices and the service was outstanding. What a fun fabulous place to go...don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing getaway!”
Reviews.Author: ndjpr
Reviews.Content: Loved it! It totally exceeded my expectations. Great food, friendly staff in an incredibly relax atmosphere. Can t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: dallist
Reviews.Content: The Lazy Parrot (TLP) is a quiet, quaint and cozy place to stay. We didn't spend much time at TLP there was not much of an atmosphere at TLP. I go to Puerto Rico about once a year, first time I have been to the west side of the Island. Rincon is great!!! Great beaches, good food, nice people. But there was not much going on at TLP. Room was nice we stood in Rm 11 which is the top room (lots of stairs). Pool was ok, Its about 3 ft deep, lol and 2nd day there the pool was cloudy and dirty, we went directly to the beach. The only thing we did at the pool was stick our feet in it one night waiting for food from the restaurant. Restaurant drinks seem pricey. If you venture out you will find other bars that have great drink prices. You must rent a car if you are staying at TLP unless you plan to only stay at the hotel, it is not close to the beach at all. If you want a quiet place to stay the LAZY parrot is the place for you. The staff is friendly and the free continental breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great mini-vacation”
Reviews.Author: happyfeet201077
Reviews.Content: ...relaxing atmosphere, great food, and friendly staff. An excellent getaway for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great relax weekend”
Reviews.Author: mreyes104
Reviews.Content: We stayed a weekend in Lazzy Parrot, and it was great. The rooms are very clean and the bed is very comfortable. The staff is very attentive, if you do not know the area offers a map and directions to places or restaurants according to your interest. The food at the restaurant was great, we ate meat and fish and really surprised us the quality and taste. The selection of wines can be improved. The waffles includes in breakfast are delicious. Definitely back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet in the off-season”
Reviews.Author: relax_n_eat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October of 2008. The weather was great during October and we were able to enjoy the outdoor pool. the place itself was pretty empty (which was a good thing, since we were looking for a getaway). The rooms were clean, and pretty big and comfortable. The air conditioning was an individual unit for the room and worked well. The bed was comfortable as well. The room did have a small fridge, large enough to hold some picnic items and drinks. Since we were here in the off season, we had a room on the top floor facing the ocean. All I can say is that the sunsets were incredible. The one 'drawback' is that the beach is not really within walking distance. Walking to the beach is downhill, on a street without sidewalks. And I am not sure if it was just my experience, but cars in Puerto Rico don't seem to go too slow. Obviously since the walk to the beach is downhill, after a day laying in the sun and being in the water going up a steep hill isn't all that fun. So if you are staying here, I recommend having a car available to go the nearby beaches and the town for the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “a quirky, fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: alixw
Reviews.Content: I chose the Lazy Parrot to stay after reading reviews here. While it is overall a great vibe, there are some quirks that might be problems for some. 1) There are a lot of stairs to be navigated, and no elevator. If you have a lot of luggage (or are disabled) you may want to stay elsewhere. 2) In two days of being there, we had no hot water. It's great that they use solar energy, but this could be a problem when you have been at the beach all day. But those two things aside, we really enjoyed our stay here, especially: 1) the bed. Wow, a great, really comfortable bed. 2) Our dinner at the restaurant. The place leases out to two restaurants, the Rum Shack and the Lazy Parrot Inn. The Rum Shack's fish tacos were just okay, but the dinner we had at the Inn was fantastic. Amazing, fresh tuna, perfectly cooked, and a salad was comped when I told the waiter it was just so-so. We really enjoyed our meal here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort - will be back again one day!”
Reviews.Author: kjl168
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Lazy Parrot from March 29th to April 2nd and we had a great time. We absolutely loved the staff and the food was great. Make sure to spend some time chatting with Mitch at the Rum Shack. Our room was very nice and very clean. We really enjoyed the pool and pool bar and the food at both the bar and restaurant was excellent. I have no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “The most marvelous food and service in Rincon!”
Reviews.Author: kat_mcgwyer
Reviews.Content: I would like to point out that I created my account on trip adviser simply because I felt my time at the Lazy Parrot was something everyone should know about. I recently ate at your restaurant and I must say this was one of the best times of my life, the dining experience at this restaurant was unequaled to anything I had ever had before. My husband and I recently purchased property in the Rincon area and celebrated by going to your restaurant, we sat at one of your patio tables and had the best service on the island. The young man who waited on us, Reno, was very helpful, and informative about the town and about your menu he started by recommending the mahi mahi for my self and the rib eye for my husband, he was so passionate about the way he described the food and the process in which it was prepared that we thought he had to be more than just a waiter, maybe a manager or owner, but he quickly told us that he was just a server, he also paired our food with some very tasty wines. The food was simply amazing, the fish was fresh and the flavors all came together perfectly on the plate, my husbands rib eye was juicy and tender and he didn't need the steak knife at all, the butter knife was sufficient, we had never thought in our wildest dreams that we would find food and service of this kind anywhere on this island since we haven't had the same luck at any of the other restaurants around town. We also understand that the restaurant is under new management, congratulations you are doing a marvelous job, we hope to eat there again when we come back in April, until then thank you very much for such a pleasant experience and good luck in the future! By the way I have read the reviews here and I must say the negative reviewers have to be out of they're minds!

Reviews.Title: “Lazy during daytime and fun during night”
Reviews.Author: ValentynaT
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the room #6 for 4 nights. Room wasn't that big but cozy. Big closet, fridge, microwave oven, air conditioner (that one was very noisy). We had problems with shower: when our neighbors were taking shower at the same time as we did water almost disappeared. And you will not be able to sleep until midnight because the location of the room is not good: there are loads of people who comes to restaurant or bar and their route goes by several rooms including room #6. We were there for surfing and fun, and we got a 30% discount from the lady on the reception so we didn't complain. Interior of the hotel is very nice with loads of parrots pictures and images and handmade furniture. they have free WiFi at the common area. Food in the hotels restaurant is not good but unexpectedly expensive. It's better to eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and quiet”
Reviews.Author: SpecialK1212
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend 5 wonderful nights at the Lazy Parrot. This was our first time at the Parrot & to Rincon. Our room overlooking the pool, was one of the best we've stayed in. The food at both the hotel restaurant & Rum Shack were great. Special thanks to Lenore at the Rum Shack helping us when we unexpectedly adopted a puppy during our visit. The only disappointing part of the trip was that the hot tub wasn't working & that the pool was too cool to use due to the time of year. We would definitely recommend the Parrot to friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: Monty2010
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to a well deserved vacation. I booked well in advance, and even spoke to the manager before arriving about the rooms. When I got there, I found they had stuck me in what was basically a utility closet with no patio and a view of the parking lot. Totally ruined my trip. Some rooms have a nice view, but half of them are terrible!! The staff was uninterested and unfriendly. And to add insult to injury, a week after I checked out they made an unauthorized $100 charge to my credit card, refused to respond as to why, and I am still disputing it. AVOID THE LAZY PARROT AT ALL COST!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great price, Great people, Top notch service-”
Reviews.Author: kpkp44
Reviews.Content: We had an 8 day stay and loved every part of it. Clean rooms, great dining, nice evening atmospere. We arrived late and had an issue with getting a rental car, The following day, the reception staff spent almost an hour handling this situation for us. Any mention of difficulties on our vacation, they instantly sprung into action for us and began working on it.. This was not by our request, but by theirs. If you are looking for a place to stay in or near Rincon, look no further. You will be well cared for and pleased with your decision!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location, with a friendly staff...but there was a lack of attention to details.”
Reviews.Author: lafern
Reviews.Content: Had wanted to stay at this hotel for years, ever since we dined there one evening, on a recommendation from a Rincon local and had a fantastic dinner. We took two two friends with us from Europe and had been raving. The place is easy to find and it unfolds itself little by little. The check-in was pleasant and the first drink at the bar was in a friendly and relaxed atmosphere, though getting drinks in a plastic cup took points off. The room was large, with a great mural and the bed was comfortable, if a little soft. There was only warm water in the shower, but it was like that justa bout everywhere I stayed on the Island. It normally doesn't bother me, but it was unseasonably cold and it would have been nice. All four of us are people who smoke a cigarette or two a day, and though most of the sitting areas are outside, we were sent outside of the gate to smoke, with no seats and no ashtray. I realize that surfer folk may not like smokers, but we were paying customers who were paying for a comfortable experience. The dinner was great. The sweet potatoes with the mahi-mahi were the best I have ever had. The sauce for the wahoo appetizer was spicier than we would have wished. The lemongrass creme brulee was to die for. Good wine list. There was free wifi. Plus points!! It did not work on my computer in the room (though it did on my husband's computer), but with such lovely tables to sit at around the property, it was hardly a hardship. The negatives. During no point in our stay, were there towels of any kind in the outdoor bathrooms and the bathroom near the Rum Bar was unpleasant. Our friend's toilet overflowed in the middle of the night from low pressure. If you need anything such as an iron or blowdryer (which surfers probably never need), make sure to ask for them upon check-in, as no one will be in the office to get them until the next morning. We all appreciated that there is a request for quiet after 11:00, but is was too bad that there was really nowhere where we could sit together and talk in the evenings. The entire experience was a mix between finding the place wonderful and finding it lacking. I would consider visiting again in hopes that we just found an off night.

Reviews.Title: “Arrived as a guest and left as a friend.”
Reviews.Author: surfer02_10
Reviews.Content: My wife found this hotel on line for my son and me, as we are surfers and Rincon is a surfing mecca. It was our first time in Rincon and getting a place figured out usually takes some time. Not the case here! The staff at the hotel were awesome. Right away they pointed out all the GREAT surfing spots, the GREAT local dining spots and in no time we felt right at home with everything. The hotel has it's own restaurant (AWESOME FOOD) and pool bar and grill where we spent every evening watching surfing movies on the big screen by the pool while enjoying a cold beer!! Heaven on earth--real close!! To get around we rented a Jeep Wrangler and were able to get real close to the beach, as sometimes the beach parking lots get crowded, so with the Jeep we could get past the paved lot and not worry about getting stuck in the sand. We traveled with our own boards, but the local surf shops had a great selection of rental boards and would give a discount if you rented for a week. The folks at the shops were really nice as well! Bottom line....we are definitely planning a return to Rincon and the Lazy Parrot next January.

Reviews.Title: “NIce place”
Reviews.Author: mulberrycoach
Reviews.Content: The spacious setting, with lots of different levels, is really lovely and charming (be prepared to go up and down a lot of steps every day). The room by the pool was roomy, comfy, clean, and pleasant, with a nice terrace and wonderful bed. The staff was generally friendly and accommodating. It would be nice if the terrace doors and bathroom windows were screened so you didn't have to be trapped in the AC at night. Additional vegetarian options at the restaurant would also lure me back (the pasta primavera really isn't worth the price), and if they made bottled water available to the guests that would be a plus too. Must say I was tempted to open the cage door and free the two shy little parrots, who hurry into their tiny houses whenever someone looks at them. All in all, though, a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stays at the Lazy Parrot”
Reviews.Author: JWFlorida
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lazy Parrot twice recently in June and August and enjoyed my stay on both occasions. The atmosphere is relaxed and the staff friendly and helpful. On both visits I had a very nice room, well appointed and extremely clean, with a balcony overlooking the pool. Breakfast was included and the hotel is well situated for all the area attractions. I am already looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great last minute getaway!”
Reviews.Author: WineGuy73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this trip based on the reviews here on tripadvisor and expedia and boy were we pleased. We stayed in one of the newer rooms on the third floor - beautiful room, great bathroom, wall-mounted A/C, super comfortable bed as well as a great view of the pool. The pool was the perfect size and temperature (I read some complaints that the water was too cold) and it was in perfect proximity to the bar (the Rum Shack). The hotel staff was really helpful - always available to answer questions and give advice. The location is great - just a two minute drive down the hill to the beach - we went to a great little spot called "the steps" or "escaleras". We also went to the beach near the Villa Cofresi hotel (which has a great happy hour by the way - $5.00 Pirata's [which is made with 151 rum, coconut water and milk] and $2.50 bacardi cocktails). While we are on the topic of cocktails, you have to go to calypso by Maria's beach - its a real layed back place with great views. At night we went to the Pool Bar to have sushi and drinks. They play surf movies on a huge screen and you can take a dip in the pool (hence the name) while you wait for your spicy tuna rolls. After dinner, head over to Tamboo (about two blocks down the road) - its right on the beach and they have a great bar and a Dj after 10pm. If you want a real authentic meal head up 414 and go to a place called the pequeno guavate - they have authentic rice and beans, lechon (roasted pig), roasted chicken and a host of other great Puerto Rican food. We really can't say enough about Rincon and the Lazy Parrot - it was a perfect vacation. Everyone at the hotel said that this was the slow season which was just fine with us. By the way, not to worry about not speaking the language - almost everyone speaks English.

Reviews.Title: “missing the parrot only 5 days after we left.”
Reviews.Author: theyarbers1
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a must do if you are looking for a out of the ordinary quiet and peaceful vacation. the rooms are spectacular the views are extraordinary. Steve was a gracious man and a wonderful source of information for things to see and do while we were there. Smiley the bartender was great and took wonderful care of us as did corrine and the other girls . the staff was exceptionally nice with ine exception the young lady who works the desk on the weekends as she seems to have an attitude. the food was good in the rum shack also a must eat are the conch fritters. Do fol;low the hotels advice and rent a car while there as the area is only easily accesible that way. all in all a great time and value as the beach is close and the zoo in mayaguez 15 miles away are all a must see take your snorkeling gear as steps beach is one of the best snokeling areas i have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “If they keep treating me the way they do, I won't get to see any other hotel in the area.”
Reviews.Author: Puertoricosigns
Reviews.Content: I was ready to write this review the day I got to the hotel, but Trip Advisor isn't cellphone friendly. I'm a local from the east of the island, and choose The Lazy Parrot for my little getaways, usually once a year. I absolutely love the place, and if I were ever to open a hotel of my own, I'd be stealing the staff. Great people, great service. I've stayed in Rooms 11, 9 and 201. On this trip I went with my wife, mom & 12 year old son and we were very comfortable in room 201 (the new building). When I go with my wife, we always request room 11. Although the new rooms are nice (very nice, actually), I still prefer the feel of room 11. (Wooden room, caribbean-ish feel, if you want to call it that). Room 9 is just a room. The hotel is very clean. I couldn't give it a solid 5, because there was a guy in a wheelchair who told me he was having a real hard time getting around. I was also a bit disappointed with the fact that they changed the mahi taco recipe! Guys, if it ain't broke, don't fix it! The LP is my kind of hotel. Nothing fancy shmancy, a great place to chill out & get away from the rat race. The town of Rincon itself is a cool, laid back place to visit. I'm back at work, already making plans to go back! Like on the title, If they keep treating me the way they do, I won't get to see any other hotel in the area!! Felix Marcano Luquillo, PR felix@puertoricosigns.com

Reviews.Title: “Totally unsatisfied”
Reviews.Author: sandybeaches2
Reviews.Content: I booked 6 nights for a romantic November '09 trip 4/28/09. Trip was paid for and confirmed. On 6/28/09 I was informed that the Lazy Parrot had cancelled my reservation. It took some doing but I finally found out they cancelled me to allow a wedding party to book the entire resort. Money talks....customer service walks...I've never been treated like that at any resort/hotel....CB

Reviews.Title: “looks are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: n_zu
Reviews.Content: Looks are deceiving, judging from the street entrance you wouldn't believe how big and pretty this place is. The place is a tourist haven, but as a local: even though this place caters mainly to tourist, I would recommend it to other fellow locals especially as a romantic or relaxing getaway plus you get a lot for you buck. You won't be bother by anyone, no staff, nothing... they are there is just that you just don't see them. We were at a superior room, OMG! Spacious, clean, super comfy king size bed, the balcony is really nice if you just want to enjoy the music from the bar but donâ€™t actually want or canâ€™t go there. (My boyfriend was sick during our stay specially Saturday night, by Sunday night he was feeling better). Breakfast included!!! Although it is continental breakfast you get a variety of breads, muffins, bagel, pastries, fruits, cereal, juices and coffee buffet style, really great to start your day. You will need a car *a must have* nearby there are beaches, surfing (just watching others is great), and other water activities, also the lighthouse. There are other things to do in towns nearby just ask the person at the souvenir store / front desk. The pool at the hotel is nice but really cold. I really enjoyed this place it would have been better if my significant other weren't sick at the time, that's why we decided to return on another occasion, maybe when thereâ€™s a movie night on schedule... that would be cool!!! *As a side note* On Saturday because of my f BFnot feeling well I ordered from Pizza Land they delivered to our room door, nice!!! Sunday we ate at the Platano Loco Rest. (Crazy Plantain Rest) in Aguada (nearby) nice food.

Reviews.Title: “Why Stay Anywhere Else?”
Reviews.Author: Matt_and_Trish
Reviews.Content: We scheduled our vacation to Rincon and The Lazy Parrot after winning a free 2-night stay at a travel expo. Tacking on an additional 6 nights, our stay at "The Parrot" was 9 days/8nights of nothing but complete relaxation and enjoyment. Chock full of character, this place is designed as a maze of walkways through gardens and grottos, with hidden nooks around every corner. Once you're here, it truly feels like a different world. If you want to lay in a shaded hammock and quietly enjoy a book, you got it. If you want to lay by the pool and soak up the rays, you got it. If you want to stroll over to the poolside bar and order up a cocktail or quick bite, you got it. Fine dining on premises, you got it. Spotlessly clean, spacious, well-appointed rooms worthy of 4 stars, you got it. But here's the best thing you've got......personalized service from a family and their staff who are second to none. Usually after a stay of this length, you can find something, even something minor, to complain about-something that you would do differently if it were your place. The only thing we would do differently is to stay longer next time! The Lazy Parrot is a one-in-a million gem and we will return, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: hykwok
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quirky and imaginative, full of parrot paraphernalia. The staff were friendly and helpful. The open pool sits right between the restaurant and the bar - dinner was pricey, but the food was delicious and very filling. There are some reggae nights, which are loud (and fun!), but they wind down by 11 pm. An extra bonus is the continental breakfast (toast, pastries, cereals, waffles, yogurt, fruits) so you can fill up before a day of surfing! The hotel is located high up on Highway 413, so it's a quaint getaway. It is by no means close to the beach, but any road can take you down there. We stayed in a superior room that faces the pool/bar/restaurant. The room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was very trendy and well supplied. My only concern was the shower: The stream was weak (and I don't like forceful showers) and I didn't really feel like I could get all the sand out of my hair. There was a little fridge in the closet which came in handy! I would recommend the Lazy Parrot to anyone. It may not be right by the beach, but it's a relaxing and hidden getaway with all the amenities of a hotel. A worthwhile stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Quiet Nights”
Reviews.Author: WellTraveledNYers
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at the Lazy Parrot last year and particularly liked the hotel's policy that guests were asked to sign a statement that they agreed to observe an after 11:00PM quiet period. The restaurant and bar also honored this policy. So we were extremely disappointed when we returned this year to find that on 3 consecutive nights the bar was selling $1 shots, had a live band poolside that played well past the self-imposed curfew and followed that rowdy live performance with more loud music on their sound system that went well into the night. When we spoke to the hotel staff about this, they informed us that the bar and restaurant were leased to other operators and that there was little t hat could be done. If you are looking for quiet nights, I would suggest you search further.

Reviews.Title: “Would've been great but for nighttime noise from bar - awful!”
Reviews.Author: Meridenborn
Reviews.Content: The night we got there was weekly reggae night at the bar which obviously is managed separately from hotel - the noise vibrated the walls until about 11:20. Next morning the hotel desk assured me that it is the only noisy night of the week, and that all noise is strictly curtailed after 11PM. Wrong! Found out Monday is surfer night with cheap drinks, live music and a rowdy crowd of surfer dudes. Parking lot was full with bar patrons, had to park on street. Hotel management is not on-site at night. Called the night number at 11:20 and got an answering machine (Spanish). Guests are clearly on their own after hours. So I got myself down to speak with the "management" at the bar, who turned out to be a young guy drinking and partying with the rest of the crowd. I pointed out that per signs posted around the place, all noise is supposed to shut off at 11PM. He didn't look happy about it but he did send the band packing. The crowd remained. At about midnight, I heard a fellow hotel guest twice yell off his balcony that it was time to cut it off, and the crowd dispersed by 1AM. I'm grateful we got out of there before the advertised St. Paddy's Day party took place. When I checked out, nobody was interested enough to ask how our stay was. Why the hotel management takes such a hands-off attitude about what goes on there after hours is beyond me. It's a real shame, because otherwise the Lazy Parrot would be a little jewel and I would give it an excellent rating. But because of the noise factor and the hotel management's curious detachment, I won't return but will instead find somewhere more peaceful in Rincon (which we loved).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but a few too many gringos”
Reviews.Author: eschuber
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, remote location, lovely pool and restaurant. The only thing I'd say is that there were a few too many young gringos hanging around acting slightly sophmoric and grooving with their MP3s. Staff is very laid back, casual atmosphere in general. Staff has good recommendations for local restaurants 5 minutes away. Tasty juices at continental breakfast with pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Pokethebear
Reviews.Content: Made reservations 4/13/08 and was assured that both bars and restaurants would be open for business. Lies! Both bars and both restaurants were closed completely. When we asked them why, they said that they had decided there wasn't enough business to bother keeping them open. When we asked them why they didn't e-mail us with the change in plans, they had no response.They did offer to serve a "continental" breakfast. This did not suffice. There are no other restaurants or bars for miles. We cancelled our reservations and stayed somewhere else. When we asked for a refund of our deposit they told us that since we cancelled at the last minute they would only refund half. We had to go through our credit card company to get the rest. We also weren't too happy with the religious ceremony that was taking place in the swimming pool. Everything had a strange, cult-like feeling about it. If you're looking for a quiet place to stay that is isolated from people, the beach, food and drink - this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and friendly place to stay, with minor gripes”
Reviews.Author: flonj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were just at the Lazy Parrot for a week. We stayed in one of the newer poolside rooms.
