The room was not really big, but lovely, and the king bed had the best mattress and pillows i have ever slept on. There was a decent size balcony with chairs overlooking the pool and gardens. The bathroom was small but nicely appointed with modern fixtures. There was a mini fridge and microwave in the room. (no cutlery though nor mugs, but you can borrow them) This hotel is not on the beach, but if you have a car it's easy to get to several beaches within minutes. Being up in the hills a bit gives you a great view (at least from our room). Beautiful garden! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only thing that really stood out as sub par was the breakfast. It consisted of corn flakes, sliced bread, sweet pastries, and very un-tropical fruits like granny smith apples and green pears. Some days there was yogurt, other days not. No other protein was available. I know it's billed as a continental breakfast, but even some hard boiled eggs and some sliced pineapple and mango would go a long way to making it more festive and satisfying. A couple of nights they had loud parties around the pool, although they stopped around 11pm or midnight. But it was loud enough that we couldn't enjoy the balcony those nights and had to retreat to the room with the door closed and the AC on. It also filled up the parking lot with party guests, so we had to find a spot on the street. But no matter. There are 2 restaurants on the premises, and both have good, though somewhat trendy, food. Certainly convenient if you don't feel like going elsewhere and the place looks great at night all lit up. We had a great time all in all, and the place is charming.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, good food & drink, friendly staff, great atmosphere and a swimming pool...”
Reviews.Author: Elle17NewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with several friends and was very happy with the cleanliness of the rooms and the friendliness of the staff. The food and cocktails were excellent and I would definitely plan on staying here the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much, we check-ed out & decided to come back”
Reviews.Author: 413Geek
Reviews.Content: Fantastic room, very comfortable beds, nice balcony overlooking the pool. Pleasant staff, nice TV and all the channels a American would want. The continental breakfast was just the icing on the cake. Great location near beaches, other resturants, plenty of parking, lots to do in Rincon area!!! The owner was around every day visiting his guests. We already are planning our return with family!!

Reviews.Title: “Lazy Parrot paradise”
Reviews.Author: Drdisc
Reviews.Content: I've been to Rincon, Puerto Rico before. Each time I go back I like more. Our recent stay was special. If you are looking for a place with personality, Puerto Rican charm, and a warm staff, all the while being nestled in the hills of Rincon, you need to try the Lazy Parrot. It's on the famous "road to happiness," 413, surrounded be the Carribean and great bakeries. We ran in to a few difficulties in our travel to Rincon and the folks at the Lazy Parrot did a great job helping us to forget our troubles and did what they could to lessen the hassles. The pool-side room with a balcony is recommended. And don't worry about noise at night. When they silence at 11:00 PM , they mean it. You will get every chance in the world to truly r&r. The food is great in either the modest priced restaurant/bar or in the more upscale restaurant. You'll need a to rent a car to get around, but this sleepy area of the island is a "can't miss." Horseback riding, scuba/snorkling, hiking, surfing,nice people, etc. our all around you. I've already sent a few folk there and am confident they'll come back satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great food at Smilin' Joe's”
Reviews.Author: jdsokc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Rincon during Christmas week 2008. We had Christmas dinner at Smilin' Joe's and it was absolutely delicious! We returned for appetizers and happy hour at the Rum Shack and were equally impressed. The portions are generous and I can't say enough about the flavor of the accompanying sauces with most of the appetizers. We will look forward to returning on our next visit to Rincon. Although we did not stay at the Lazy Parrot Inn, the hotel appeared nice and the pool area was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Islandgirl00765
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip around the entire island of Puerto Rico. We stayed at many hotels. I must say that The Lazy Parrot was my favorite. All the hotel staff were polite and helpful. The room was clean and nicely decorated. There are three bars and at least two restaurants. I do not like to stay in HUGE hotels, I like a hotel that feels more personal and quaint and the Lazy Parrot was all of that. You are a short drive to the beaches and many different restaurants as well. I would totally recommend staying at The Lazy Parrot.

Reviews.Title: “We Love The Lazy Parrot”
Reviews.Author: bandit718
Reviews.Content: We love the Lazy Parrot! We stayed (family of 5) 12/24/-12/29 and had a great time relaxing and enjoying ourselves. The rooms were comfortable and tastefully decorated. We loved dinner at Smilin Joe's and drinks and lunch at the Rum Shack. The gift shop is absolutely packed with the cutest trinkets and souveniers. The front desk staff were accomadating, friendly, and always helpful. Even the cleaning crew was nice! We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lazy Parrot - nice but some issues”
Reviews.Author: oxfordmike
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lazy Parrot for a week in December 2008 Location â€“ in the hills a mile or so from beaches. Even though not on beach itâ€™s still a good place to stay. Things to do in Rincon (beaches, bars, shops etc) are scattered over several areas and the Lazy Parrot is more or less in the centre of things. You need a car though. Several excellent coffee shops, deli/cafes within walking distance Building - New small 3 storey hotel block overlooking nice pool area and older block of a few room next to road and restaurant. All generally attractive and well maintained Great views over hills with sea in distance. No lift â€“ so you need to be fit if you have heavy bags. Room â€“ Nice, spacious room with great balcony. Loads of storage space, comfortable bed, excellent air conditioning and good quiet ceiling fan. Small but adequate bathroom (but no hot water on several occasions). Fridge and microwave. Excellent levels of cleanliness. Friendly and efficient â€“ when they were around (see below) Food etc. Basic but adequate free continental breakfast. Two good restaurants and bars on-site â€“ under separate management. Drinks expensive. Issues â€“ there are some basic but related issue with the Lazy Parrot due to the owner having leased out the bars and restaurants. One problem, for example, is that, while the pool bar shut at around 11pm, the other bar only few yards away seem to retain a very noisy crowd until the early hours and the courtyard layout echoes the noise. As far as I could see the people at the bar where not staying at the hotel and the barman did not seem to be bothered that they were keeping us awake. New Yearsâ€™ party was worse. We went out and came back at around 12.30am to find some small clusters of kids (not staying at the hotel) dancing to a very, very noisy disco. The hotelâ€™s party was supposed to finish at 1am, but at 1.30am the absolutely deafening disco was still shaking the walls of our room (would have gone out and joined them if the music had been any good!). Eventually I put on some clothes and went out and asked the DJ to turn down the sound â€“ at which point he immediately turned it off, saying that he was due to finish by then. The owner of the restaurant was there and he should have been aware of the hotel guests â€“ but presumably wanted to keep the party going. Another related problem is that the staff working in the two restaurants and bars donâ€™t want to know about hotel issues. As the hotelâ€™s staff goes home at 5pm one has to phone the owner if one has a problem after 5pm.

Reviews.Title: “It was a cozzy, small and beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Veivalina
Reviews.Content: I checked the reviews so I knew I couldn't be wrong. Lazzy Parrot does not have extra new or modern stuff, but cozzy and warm rooms with different decoration (ours had the turtles on the wall), very peaceful, perfect and complete enough continental breakfast, small cute pool and bar.

Reviews.Title: “bugs”
Reviews.Author: luz17
Reviews.Content: first of all, it's nowhere near the airport. second when we first got there noone was on site no one to welcome us. i was tired from my trip i just wanted to take a shower and go to bed. when i opened the door to the hotel room the room was so tiny there was two bed and a night stand between the two bed., after taking my shower i turned down the covers and saw bugs all over the bed and the pillow. i screamed and we left the hotel. they refuse to reimburse us because someone (me) use the shower. i would hate for someone to have to go through what i went through.

Reviews.Title: “Laid Back and Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_ar0und
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. The atmosphere was relaxing. The staff was excellent. It was calm and peaceful. No one bothered us. The grounds were kept clean. The mosquitos were the only drawback. The retaurant Smilin' Joes was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie1717
Reviews.Content: Wow- what a way to end a week long vacation! We flew in to San Juan and drove to almost every corner of Puerto Rico. Our last 2 nights we stayed at the Lazy Parrot, As one previous post said, the outside of the hotel does not give you any idea how nice it is once you get inside. We tried to avoid the "chain hotels" and tried out several locally owned properties which was a good choice. I am a clean freak and I can honestly say that this hotel was by far the cleanest and most comfortable place we have stayed in a long time. The only down side for us was that we didn't realize that lots of restaurants and bars close up completely in the off season which apparently is just before Labor Day until October or November. The restaurant in The Lazy Parrot was closed There was a basic continental breakfast available after 8:00 am, but since I am an early bird I had to go next door to the bakery for early coffee. We drove to 2 different restaurants by the beach for dinner and both were good. The layout of the Lazy Parrot and the grounds are beautiful. The fixtures in the bathroom were all new and very attractive. Plenty of hot water and air conditioning was great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived late (after the office closed) and they actually left our key on the bulletin board for us! Not too many hotels would make the extra effort to do that. I can't recommend this hotel enough, even though we came at a bad time, it was a truly wonderful place to stay. One tip though- it is not near the beach or downtown Rincon. You definitely need a car to stay here. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “the lazy parrot ricon was great”
Reviews.Author: jedifish
Reviews.Content: Anyone traveling to the Rincon area of Puerto Rico would be well served to find the lazy parrot hotel. I stayed there recently and loved the laid back feel and outstanding food. Acually I stayed in a couple 400$ a night resorts while in Puerto rico --ie-El conquistador in fajardo and the Hilton in San Juan and the food at the little lazy parrot beat anything I had else ware hands down. Smiley the bar tender, and Marco the cook do a bang up job. the hotel rooms are simple but nice, bathrooms are small but functional and the price was right 179$ per night for two single guys traveling this hotel was perfect. I will definatly find my way back there some day.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: needbettermattress
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our kids stayed here recently. We were definitely thrilled about staying at the Parrot again, we had stayed last year in room 11, for a romantic getaway- it was wonderful. This time we stayed superior poolside and were extremely comfortable, the room was beautiful(Very clean). The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. The restaurant had a delicious menu and their mixed drinks were great, great staff too. The continental breakfast was great, a lot of choices, not just coffee and donuts- definitely deluxe. It bears mentioning that it was the best mattress at any hotel so far. We're definitely planning on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lazy Parrot the best place to stay in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: bearcattwo
Reviews.Content: We were there for a week and loved it. Will stay here next time we visit Puerto Rico and we recommend it to anyone visiting the Rincon or surrounding area. All the staff were excellent and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: badabng
Reviews.Content: We found the Lazy Parrot via an internet search. We contacted the receptionist who assured us that we would be pleasantly surprised with our balcony view and room. We decided to book the room for a 5 day stay during the Easter vacation. One of the first things that I noticed about the Lazy Parrot is that once you get there you need to park across the street from the actual Inn. We had to carry our luggage up a flight of stairs through a restaurant and down several flights of stairs to get to the check in. Once we checked in we had to carry our luggage back up several flights of stairs through the restaurant and up another flight of stairs. If you have difficulty going up and down stairs this is not the place for you. Our balcony view was nothing special but our room was very clean and well maintained. During our stay there we met with the owners who where there daily and seemed like very nice people. My family and I spent a lot of time by the pool which was great and had drinks and food from the Rum Shack. The food and drinks at the Rum Shack and Smilin Joe were great however Iâ€™m not too sure of the math that they were using at the Rum Shack. It seems that several times our bill was padded and we ended up paying more than what we should have. Overall the Lazy Parrot is not a bad place to stay at. Would I go back? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place”
Reviews.Author: 2schlaffs
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I just returned from staying here for 4 nights. We had a very good stay at the Lazy Parrot. It is simple and clean with suitable food options on-site and very friendly staff. I had found a deal on Expedia on our room and so we were in the older section of the hotel which is probably more budget friendly. We did not have any problems with it and were happy with our accomodations. A few things to be aware of, the "balcony" for our room (room 9) was actually just a wide entry way with a couple chairs and our room was right at the front of the hotel so there was some noise from the road. Finding the office to check-in is a bit of a scavenger hunt when you first arrive as you have to wind up and down several sets of stairs and through the beautiful gardens to the other side of the hotel. Definitely leave your bags in the car until you find out where your room is located. While we are in our 30's, it appeared that several of the other guests were seniors and very much enjoying themselves. The breakfast was good, mostly just danishes and toast though and once things run out they aren't readily replaced. The mornings we were down earlier there was some yogurt, fruit and coffee cream, some of the other mornings, there was not. The hot water situation can be a little bit annoying...after a day of beach-going or hiking a warm shower can be nice and only 2 of 4 of my showers included warm water. Overall though, we were very happy with our stay here and would easily stay here again or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good times in RIncon”
Reviews.Author: lambert13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Lazy Parrot during January of 2008 for 5 days. We stayed at the Rincon Beach Resort for the first part of our stay because the Lazy Parrot had no availability for those days. In our opinion, the Lazy Parrot wins, hands down. It is a very good value for your dollar kind of place. The good: - Nice clean spacious room. Good bathroom. I really liked the balcony/patio outside of our Panoramic room. - Continental breakfast in the morning. Always fresh and fully stocked. It was nice even to go sit out by the pool in the morning and have a cup of coffee. - The Rum Shack. Love love love that place. Reggae night was a whole lot of fun. - Smilin Joes. Great food even though it's a bit overpriced. The Bad: (nothing really bad, just wanted the contrasting title) - The roosters across the street. They woke me up at 4am our first night there. Second night had no problem with them - The only other bad thing is that I am not there right now. Some other Rincon highlights..... - Tamboo. Good food, good people, good bar, great view, good times all around - Rock Bottom. Awesome place to hang out - Panderia Libonese. Best breakfast sandwiches in town. Other than that, just rent a car and go explore. There is so much to see and do on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Some drawbacks but very charming”
Reviews.Author: SineadM
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Puerto Rico where we spend part of our trip in Rincon at The Lazy Parrot Inn. It is nestled in the hills and has views of the ocean. We stayed in the new building - our room was comfortable, clean and nicely decorated with a large balcony overlooking the swimming pool. There is a casual, friendly feel to the place and it was a nice contrast to the large resort in San Juan where we had stayed. The pool is nice but the hot tub was cold during our visit. There are 2 restaurants, one outdoors by the pool which has a decent menu and good food. We did not eat at the restaurant upstairs which is a little more formal but the menu looked inviting. There are some lovely outdoor tables set in little secluded areas. There are 2 cages with parrots and love birds that our kids loved. Our stay included continental breakfast which again was eaten by the pool. While waiting for our dinner the first night, our kids played with other kids around the pool area while we chatted with other guests. It was definately relaxing for us and our children. On the downside, when we arrived, we had already been in Peurto Rico for a week and had three big pieces of luggage. We had to lift them up a flight of stairs, then down a series of steps at the other side and then up two flights of stairs to our room!!! I asked if there was anyone to help with bags and was told no! On our departure, we discovered that we could drive down the side of the inn and bring our bags out by the bar but that still involved lugging them down two flights. Also, on our first night, the ice machine was out of ice and the blender to make frozen drinks was broken. The second night we stayed, there was an engagement party by the pool and some other event going on and the place was crowded. We placed our order for dinner shortly before 8pm and at 8:40pm were told that they were out of one of the items that we ordered. I ordered a salad instead (thinking it would be quick) but by 9pm still no food and one of our kids had fallen asleep. At that point, we cancelled our order and went to our room. There was music blaring by the pool until 11pm which was right underneath our balcony. This may have been a once off - the waiter was really haried - but it might be worth checking with them if there are any parties scheduled during your stay. Also, there is a small step-up going from the pool area to the breakfast area that is not that obvious and we noticed a few people trip over it. On the morning we were leaving, a woman fell over it dropping a glass plate and landed on a piece of broken glass that went into her knee. This is a definate hazard that could be easily rectified by painting the step up a bright color. Pool hours are only from 10am to 6pm but did not seem to be strictly enforced. Our kids are early risers and bugged us from 8am to go in the pool but we did not permit them because of the rule. We were more comfortable with breaking it when other guests were swimming in the pool outside these hours. You also need your own towels to bring to the beach, which we did not know. On the whole, we loved the ambiance and the casual laid back feel at the Lazy Parrot. I think we were unfortunate on our second night and that this may have been an anomoly. We would give it another try.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but Great”
Reviews.Author: TheSimpleTraveler
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a budget priced accomodation to rest our bodies for 5 nights so that we could enjoy the warmth of Rincon, Puerto Rico during the day time. The Lazy Parrot fit the bill perfectly. Our accomodations were simple and clean. Although the room was small and cozy, it was just right for my wife and I. Afterall, we didn't come to Rincon in the middle of the winter to stay in a room. We were there to enjoy the beaches, the sunshine, the people and the drinks! Booking the room over the Internet was easy. Franzia, the hostess answered any questions I had via e-mail. The check-in was easy. Considering the fact that we arrived at the Inn at about 1am, we had no trouble checking into our room as Franzia had given us instructions as to what to expect and where our key would be located. The Inn has a distinct tropical ambience to it. It has a quaint tropical setting, a nice pool and a soothing breeze, which always seemed to caress us any time of the day. The place was quiet during the day and a bit lively at night as it anchors a restaurant, Smilin' Joe's and a pool bar, The Rum Shack. We didn't get to sample the fare at Smilin' Joe's, but we did frequent The Rum Shack several times during our stay. We enjoyed their hot wings immensely. A simple continental breakfast awaited us each morning and was just right to take us into lunch. Nothing fancy, but enough to suffice our appetites. For those travelers who are conscious of the environment, the Lazy Parrot is a Green Hotel. They do their best to conserve the resources with solar cells to heat their water, which brings to mind about the only slight inconvenience of our stay. Because one or two days were cloudy, for one day our shower water was not as warm as we would have liked it. And the hot tub wasn't that hot either. But we didn't need to use the hot tub and we took a quick shower. The remaining days our showers were hot. To sum it up, if you are looking for elegance and pampering, the Lazy Parrot would most likely not be your style. But if you are a budget minded traveler, looking for a simple getaway mixed with some fun, in the hills of Rincon, you can't go wrong with this place. In fact, my wife and I hope to return there next winter.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Grandmajoan
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week (less a missed day due to a Useless Airways snafu). Enjoyed the breakfast on the patio, the pool, the bar, the two restaurants. The room in the new building was spacious, comfortable and clean. Would highly recommend the hotel for those seeking a beautiful setting at a reasonable price. The property is on a hillside with lots of steps to climb, so I would not recommend it to those who find steps difficult to negotiate.
